Simeon the Potter (5th/6th cent. ) [ Syr. Orth. ]. Author of nine short poems on the Nativity. When Yaʿqub of Serugh came across him working as a potter ( quqoyo ) in Geshir, a village in north Syria, he soon recognized his poetic talents. Imitations of his poems gave rise to a specific genre of poems, designated ‘ quqoye ’. Sources S. P.  Brock, Bride of Light. Hymns on Mary from the Syriac Churches (Moran Etho 6; 1994), 102–8. ( ET ) S. Euringer, in OC II.3 (1913), 221–35. (Syr. with GT ) Sebastian P. Brock
